S.FORM: soni pitu takananga mukusa ku tarisinata.
soni pito takananga mokosa ko tarisinata.
S.TRANSL: 我今天七點到學校。
I arrived at school at seven today.

S.FORM: kiatuturu cu. musikarʉ takituturua. makasi pan-cang: "aratakaraa! musu'ʉvʉ!"
kiatotoro co. mosikarʉ takitotoroa. makasi pan-cang: "aratakaraa! moso'ʉvʉ!"
S.TRANSL: 上課了，老師走進教室，班長說:「起立!敬禮!」
It’s time for class , the teacher walked into the classroom, and the monitor said: “Stand up! Salute!”

S.FORM: masitatia kim makasi: "manʉng takituturua!"
masitatia kim makasi: "manʉng takitotoroa!"
S.TRANSL: 我們大聲的說:「老師好！」
We said loudly, “Hi, teacher.”

S.FORM: miaa kiatuturu, tumatuturu kimia takituturua sʉpʉrʉ tamna kari.
miaa kiatotoro, tomatotoro kimia takitotoroa sʉpʉrʉ tamna kari.
S.TRANSL: 上課的時候，老師教我們數字的族語。
In class, the teacher taught us the Kanakanavu language of numbers.

S.FORM: tuapapa kim sumasʉpʉrʉ. paracani kim sʉpʉrʉ tamna cani.
toapapa kim somasʉpʉrʉ. paracani kim sʉpʉrʉ tamna cani.
S.TRANSL: 我們跟著老師唸，我們唱了數字歌。
We followed the teacher to read, we sang the number song.

S.FORM: takutavara'ʉ ku 'itumuru kari Kanakanavu.
takotavara'ʉ ko 'itomoro kari Kanakanavo.
S.TRANSL: 我學會好多族語。
I have learned many Kanakanavu languages.

S.FORM: tantaniara ku mukusa tarisinata. tantaniara kiatuturu kari Kanakanavu. tia ku 'apatimana cina.
tantaniara ko mokosa tarisinata. tantaniara kiatotoro kari Kanakanavo. tia ko 'apatimana cina.
S.TRANSL: 我天天上學，我天天學族語，我要講給媽媽聽。
I go to school every day, I learn the Kanakanavu language every day, and I want to tell my mother.

S.FORM: sua nganai maku ia Mu'u.
soa nganai mako ia Mo'o.
S.TRANSL: 我的名字是Mu’u。
My name is Mu’u.

S.FORM: nganai cuma maku ia 'Una.
nganai coma mako ia 'Una.
S.TRANSL: 我爸爸的名字是’Una。
My dad’s name is ’Una.

S.FORM: nganai cina maku ia Paicʉ.
nganai cina mako ia Paicʉ.
S.TRANSL: 我媽媽的名字是Paicʉ。
My mother’s name is Paicʉ.

S.FORM: cenana isi. maan cenana ku.
cenana isi. maan cenana ko.
S.TRANSL: 我今年10歲。
I am 10 years old.

S.FORM: 'una ku tacini kana'ua sarunai, Pori kisʉʉn. cenana isi maan cani cenana sua nguain.
'ona ko tacini kana'oa saronai, Pori kisʉʉn. cenana isi maan cani cenana soa ngoain.
S.TRANSL: 我有一個哥哥，他叫Pori。他今年11歲。
I have a brother, his name is Pori, he is 11 years old.

S.FORM: 'esi kim matʉa tarisinata marisinatʉ.
'esi kim matʉa tarisinata marisinatʉ.
S.TRANSL: 我們在同一間學校讀書。
We study in the same school.

S.FORM: iku mataa kana'ua sarunai manmaan kim paracani.
iko mataa kana'oa saronai manmaan kim paracani.
S.TRANSL: 我和哥哥都喜歡唱歌。
Both my brother and I like to sing.

S.FORM: manmaan ku makananguru, noo tarasangara taniara, cani pininga kim arakukunu arapiningi makananguru.
manmaan ko makanangoro, noo tarasangara taniara, cani pininga kim arakokono arapiningi makanangoro.
S.TRANSL: 我喜歡游泳，放假的時候，我們全家會一起去游泳。
I like swimming. During the holidays, our whole family go swimming together.

S.FORM: manmaan ku tarakanangʉ vo'orua tangria, tʉni kim arakukunu paracani mataa makananguru.
manmaan ko tarakanangʉ vo'oroa tangria, tʉni kim arakokono paracani mataa makanangoro.
S.TRANSL: 我喜歡認識新朋友，我們可以一起唱歌和游泳。
I love meeting new people, we can sing and swim together.

S.FORM: sua iku ia manu Kanakanavu.
soa iko ia mano Kanakanavo.
S.TRANSL: 我是卡那卡那富族的小孩。
I am an Kanakanavu child.

S.FORM: 'esi Namasia sua tanasa mia.
'esi Namasia soa tanasa mia.
S.TRANSL: 我們家住在那瑪夏。
Our family lives in Namasia.

S.FORM: rarima kim cani pininga.
rarima kim cani pininga.
S.TRANSL: 我們家共有五個人。
There are five people in our family.

S.FORM: taturu kim kinvavara.
tatoro kim kinvavara.
S.TRANSL: 我們家有三個兄弟姊妹。
There are three brothers and sisters in our family.

S.FORM: 'utumʉkʉnʉ ku mataa cuma, cina, kana'ua sarunai, kana'ua nanakʉ.
'otomʉkʉnʉ ko mataa coma, cina, kana'oa saronai, kana'oa nanakʉ.
S.TRANSL: 我跟爸爸、媽媽、哥哥和姊姊住在一起。
I live with my father, mother, brother and sister.

S.FORM: marʉngʉcai cuma maku. kesacu sua cuma maku.
marʉngʉcai coma mako. kesaco soa coma mako.
S.TRANSL: 我的爸爸很高。我的爸爸是警察。
My father is tall and he is a policeman.

S.FORM: ta'uici cina maku. 'iseeng sua cina maku.
ta'oici cina mako. 'iseeng soa cina mako.
S.TRANSL: 我的媽媽很瘦。我的媽媽是醫生。
My mother is thin and my mom is a doctor.

S.FORM: masiKanakanavu cuma maku na tanasa.
masiKanakanavo coma mako na tanasa.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸在家會和我們說族語。
My father speaks the Kanakanavu language with us at home.

S.FORM: tarasangara kana'ʉcana paira kim pui'i tanasʉn.
tarasangara kana'ʉcana paira kim poi'i tanasʉn.
S.TRANSL: 我們暑假都會回部落。
We will all go back to the tribe during the summer vacation.

S.FORM: arakukunu ku mataa kana'ua nanakʉ matisa'ʉ takarura.
arakokono ko mataa kana'oa nanakʉ matisa'ʉ takarora.
S.TRANSL: 我和兄姊會一起抓青蛙。
My brothers and sisters and I will catch frogs together.

S.FORM: manmaan ku cani pininga maku.
manmaan ko cani pininga mako.
S.TRANSL: 我很喜歡我們家的人。
I like our family very much.

S.FORM: soni arapiningi ku mataa cina sumasima'ʉ.
soni arapiningi ko mataa cina somasima'ʉ.
S.TRANSL: 今天我和媽媽出去玩。
I went out with my mother today.

S.FORM: ca'ania mangiri taniara. ka'anʉ makungu, ka'anʉ macici. maparipi pariapara.
ca'ania mangiri taniara. ka'anʉ makongo, ka'anʉ macici. maparipi pariapara.
S.TRANSL: 白天的天空很藍，天氣不冷也不熱，風很涼爽。
The sky is blue during the day, the weather is neither cold nor hot, and the wind is cool.

S.FORM: 'esi kim racʉcʉnʉa kumakʉnʉ mien-pau. pariʉn taniarʉ, cucuru ma'avu.
'esi kim racʉcʉnʉa komakʉnʉ mien-pao. pariʉn taniarʉ, cocoro ma'avo.
S.TRANSL: 我們在草地上吃著麵包。陽光灑在身上，非常溫暖。
We ate bread on the grass, the sun was shining on us, and it was very warm.

S.FORM: nuca'ania, niaramasinang cu kakangca.
noca'ania, niaramasinang co kakangca.
S.TRANSL: 下午，天空變紅了。
In the afternoon, the sky turned red.

S.FORM: kesoniʉn maku cina, neni vanai masinang sua kakangca?
kesoniʉn mako cina, neni vanai masinang soa kakangca?
S.TRANSL: 我問媽媽，為甚麼天空是紅色的？
I asked my mother why the sky is red.

S.FORM: makasi cina, manasʉ 'una raru tia iavatu.
makasi cina, manasʉ 'ona raro tia iavato.
S.TRANSL: 媽媽說，可能是颱風要來了。
Mom said, maybe the typhoon is coming.

S.FORM: rovana, 'akia ʉcʉ na kakangca. arapiningi tamtasai.
rovana, 'akia ʉcʉ na kakangca. arapiningi tamtasai.
S.TRANSL: 晚上天上沒有雲。星星出來了。
There were no clouds in the sky at night, and the stars came out.

S.FORM: tia cu kim pui'i tanasa.
tia co kim poi'i tanasa.
S.TRANSL: 我們也要回家了。
We were going home too.

S.FORM: na pui'i tanasa cacanʉ, masikusa ku na tamtasai parasingsing.
na poi'i tanasa cacanʉ, masikosa ko na tamtasai parasingsing.
S.TRANSL: 在回家的路上，我跟星星許願，
On the way home, I made a wish with the stars,

S.FORM: kamʉcʉ ka'anʉ iavatu raru, tia pa kim arapiningi sumasima'ʉ.
kamʉcʉ ka'anʉ iavato raro, tia pa kim arapiningi somasima'ʉ.
S.TRANSL: 希望颱風不要來，我還想再出去玩。
I hope the typhoon doesn't come, I still want to go out to play again.

S.FORM: tarisinata maku 'esi na ciciri tanasa mia. tantaniara ku mucaca mukusa tarisinata. mucaca pui'i tanasa.
tarisinata mako 'esi na ciciri tanasa mia. tantaniara ko mocaca mokosa tarisinata. mocaca poi'i tanasa.
S.TRANSL: 我的學校在我們家旁邊。我天天走路去學校。也走路回家。
My school is next to our house, I walk to school every day, and I also walk home.

S.FORM: ka'anʉ tatia tarisinata mia. ka'anʉ kacaua seto. patarakanangʉ kim.
ka'anʉ tatia tarisinata mia. ka'anʉ kacaoa seto. patarakanangʉ kim.
S.TRANSL: 我們學校不大。沒有很多學生。大家互相認識。
Our school is not big, there are not many students, everyone knows each other.

S.FORM: kavangvang mamanu paira arakukunu na tarapana'ʉa. kamamari, parʉ'ʉna.
kavangvang mamano paira arakokono na tarapana'ʉa. kamamari, parʉ'ʉna.
S.TRANSL: 所有小朋友會聚在操場。一起玩球、一起聊天。
All the children will gather in the playground, play ball and chat together.

S.FORM: takituturua iavatu kangvang arakukunu kimia sumasima'ʉ. tarisinata makai tatia cani pininga.
takitotoroa iavato kangvang arakokono kimia somasima'ʉ. tarisinata makai tatia cani pininga.
S.TRANSL: 老師們也會和我們一起玩。學校是個大家庭。
The teachers also play with us, the school is one big family.

S.FORM: tantaniara kim tia marisiki. pasa'ʉcaiʉn mia 'aravang tarisinata.
tantaniara kim tia marisiki. pasa'ʉcaiʉn mia 'aravang tarisinata.
S.TRANSL: 我們每天都要打掃。大家要把教室打掃乾淨。
We have to clean every day, and everyone has to clean the classroom.

S.FORM: 'una cau mururu tasinʉva, 'una cau marisiki.
'ona cao mororo tasinʉva, 'ona cao marisiki.
S.TRANSL: 有些人去擦窗戶，有些人去掃地。
Some people clean the windows, some sweep the floor.

S.FORM: marisiki pa kim cikiringa tarisinata. pasovungu kim putukioa. tantaniara sua tarisinata masa'ʉcai.
marisiki pa kim cikiringa tarisinata. pasovongo kim potokioa. tantaniara soa tarisinata masa'ʉcai.
S.TRANSL: 我們還會打掃學校的各個角落。大家分工合作。學校每天都很乾淨。
We will also clean every corner of the school. Everyone works together, and the school is very clean every day.

S.FORM: miʉra, nimukusa ku tanasʉn rovʉvʉ na tamu.
miʉra, nimokosa ko tanasʉn rovʉvʉ na tamo.
S.TRANSL: 昨天，我去部落拜訪爺爺。
Yesterday, I went to visit my grandpa in the tribe.

S.FORM: miaranau cu kim koo 'arupacʉ'ʉra. pacʉpʉngʉ ku 'inia.
miaranao co kim koo 'aropacʉ'ʉra. pacʉpʉngʉ ko 'inia.
S.TRANSL: 我們很久沒有見面了，我很想念他。
We haven’t seen each other for a long time and I miss him a lot.

S.FORM: cumacʉ'ʉra 'ikua tamu, makacang 'apakʉnʉ 'ikua vakatʉ, 'apima nangira.
comacʉ'ʉra 'ikoa tamo, makacang 'apakʉnʉ 'ikoa vakatʉ, 'apima nangira.
S.TRANSL: 爺爺一看到我，就請我吃西瓜，請我喝茶。
As soon as grandpa saw me, he invited me to eat watermelon and drink tea.

S.FORM: matavi'isi nimʉkʉa tamu vakatʉ, cucuru sa'o'o!
matavi'isi nimʉkʉa tamo vakatʉ, cocoro sa'o'o!
S.TRANSL: 爺爺種的西瓜很甜，真的很好吃！
The watermelon grown by grandpa is very sweet and really delicious.

S.FORM: manmaan ku kangvang tamu tamna nangira, manʉng imʉʉn.
manmaan ko kangvang tamo tamna nangira, manʉng imʉʉn.
S.TRANSL: 我也喜歡爺爺的茶，也很好喝。
I also like grandpa’s tea, it’s tasted good too.

S.FORM: miaa vʉcʉkai ca'ania, takacocua ku mataa tamu nanakʉ po'ucipi tia kuca'ania.
miaa vʉcʉkai ca'ania, takacocoa ko mataa tamo nanakʉ po'ocipi tia koca'ania.
S.TRANSL: 中午的時候，我和奶奶一起煮午餐。
At noon, I cooked lunch with my grandma.

S.FORM: macakuarʉ nipo'ucipia tamu nanakʉ. 'una vutukuru, tarukuka, tangtang mataa pʉrʉkʉ karavung.
macakoarʉ nipo'ocipia tamo nanakʉ. 'ona votokoro, tarokoka, tangtang mataa pʉrʉkʉ karavong.
S.TRANSL: 奶奶煮了很豐盛的午餐。有魚、有雞、有南瓜、還有蝸牛。
Grandma cooked a big lunch, including fish, chicken, pumpkin, and snails.

S.FORM: nikuca'ania cu, mukusa kim tanatʉngʉa mara tatʉngʉ.
nikoca'ania co, mokosa kim tanatʉngʉa mara tatʉngʉ.
S.TRANSL: 吃完午餐後，我們去菜園摘菜。
After lunch, we went to the vegetable garden to pick vegetables.

S.FORM: nimara tamu nanakʉ 'itumuru tammi, tanʉkʉ mataa cʉngaa, 'apavici 'ikua mutanasa.
nimara tamo nanakʉ 'itomoro tammi, tanʉkʉ mataa cʉngaa, 'apavici 'ikoa motanasa.
S.TRANSL: 奶奶拿了很多地瓜、芋頭和蕗蕎給我，要我帶回家。
Grandma brought me a lot of sweet potatoes, taro and buckwheat, and asked me to take them home.

S.FORM: musu'ʉvʉ ku nguani, makasi 'arupacʉ'ʉra pai!
moso'ʉvʉ ko ngoani, makasi 'aropacʉ'ʉra pai!
S.TRANSL: 我跟他們道別，說下次再去看他們！
I said goodbye to them and said I’d see them next time.

S.FORM: soni marivici kimia takituturua mukusa tarʉkʉpʉ marʉkurapʉ. matavʉnʉrʉ kim na ta'aravanga pu'a kipu.
soni marivici kimia takitotoroa mokosa tarʉkʉpʉ marʉkorapʉ. matavʉnʉrʉ kim na ta'aravanga po'a kipo.
S.TRANSL: 今天老師帶我們去動物園。我們在門口排隊買票。
Today the teacher took us to the zoo, and we lined up at the gate to buy tickets.

S.FORM: musikarʉ na tarʉkʉpʉ marʉkurapʉ. makasi takituturua, "tu'urua ia tapinange, kukuca ia vunai. takacicinia cumacʉ'ʉra."
mosikarʉ na tarʉkʉpʉ marʉkorapʉ. makasi takitotoroa, "to'oroa ia tapinange, kokoca ia vonai. takacicinia comacʉ'ʉra."
S.TRANSL: so you can visit them yourself.""
After entering the zoo, the teacher said, There are birds in the front and snakes in the back

S.FORM: ma'icʉpʉ ku vunai. imua ka'anʉ ku cumacʉ'ʉra vunai.
ma'icʉpʉ ko vonai. imoa ka'anʉ ko comacʉ'ʉra vonai.
S.TRANSL: 我會怕蛇，所以我不看蛇類。
I'm afraid of snakes, so I don't look at snakes.

S.FORM: cumacʉ'ʉra ku 'itumuru tapinange. 'esi na karu mingangane. 'una pa puka na tarako karu si'icʉpʉ.
comacʉ'ʉra ko 'itomoro tapinange. 'esi na karo mingangane. 'ona pa poka na tarako karo si'icʉpʉ.
S.TRANSL: 我看到了很多鳥，他們在樹上飛來飛去，還有看到貓頭鷹在樹洞裡睡覺。
I saw a lot of birds flying around in the trees and saw owls sleeping in tree hollows.

S.FORM: 'esi na tarʉkʉpʉ marʉkurapʉ, 'una ta-siang, 'uma mataa rau-hu. miana koo pa ku cinimʉ'ʉra marʉkurapʉ isi. campe soni cumacʉ'ʉra, cucuru macangcangarʉ.
'esi na tarʉkʉpʉ marʉkorapʉ, 'ona ta-siang, 'oma mataa rao-ho. miana koo pa ko cinimʉ'ʉra marʉkorapʉ isi. campe soni comacʉ'ʉra, cocoro macangcangarʉ.
S.TRANSL: 動物園裡有大象、馬和老虎，我從前沒有看過這些動物，今天看到了，真的很開心。
There are elephants, horses and tigers in the zoo. I have never seen these animals before. I was really happy to see them today.

S.FORM: patara'aningu ku 'itumuru siasing, 'apacʉ'ʉra cuma cina.
patara'aningo ko 'itomoro siasing, 'apacʉ'ʉra coma cina.
S.TRANSL: 我拍了很多照片，給爸爸媽媽看。
I took a lot of pictures and showed them to my parents.

S.FORM: maka'ʉna tia ku arakukunu cuma cina iavatu nesi.
maka'ʉna tia ko arakokono coma cina iavato nesi.
S.TRANSL: 下次要跟爸爸媽媽一起來。
Next time I will come with my parents.

S.FORM: tarasangara isi, iku mataa kana'ua mukusa Taitung rovʉvʉ na cuma vuravurau.
tarasangara isi, iko mataa kana'oa mokosa Taitong rovʉvʉ na coma voravorao.
S.TRANSL: 這個假日，我和姊姊去台東拜訪叔叔。
This holiday, my sister and I went to Taitung to visit my uncle.

S.FORM: aranai kim Taipe tukisia mukusa Taitung.
aranai kim Taipe tokisia mokosa Taitong.
S.TRANSL: 我們從台北搭火車去臺東。
We took the train from Taipei to Taitung.

S.FORM: makacʉkʉna Taitung, cuma vuravurau 'unting kuruma iavatu tatuparaa kisia matʉnʉsʉ kimia.
makacʉkʉna Taitong, coma voravorao 'onting koroma iavato tatoparaa kisia matʉnʉsʉ kimia.
S.TRANSL: 到了台東，叔叔開車來車站接我們。
When we arrived in Taitung, my uncle drove to the station to pick us up.

S.FORM: tatuparaa kisia ka'anʉ araceni tanasa cuma vuravurau, 'unting kuruma makacang makacʉkʉna.
tatoparaa kisia ka'anʉ araceni tanasa coma voravorao, 'onting koroma makacang makacʉkʉna.
S.TRANSL: 車站離叔叔家沒有很遠，開車一下子就到了。
The station is not far from my uncle's house, and it's just a short drive away.

S.FORM: capici cuma vuravurau tamna tanasa, 'una 'inia tatia tacʉvʉrʉ marʉkurapʉ. tutanpu kim mukusa 'inia.
capici coma voravorao tamna tanasa, 'ona 'inia tatia tacʉvʉrʉ marʉkorapʉ. totanpo kim mokosa 'inia.
S.TRANSL: 叔叔家附近，有個很大的牧場。我們一起騎腳踏車到牧場。
There is a big ranch near my uncle's house, and we rode bicycles to the ranch together.

S.FORM: 'esi na tacʉvʉrʉ marʉkurapʉ. marivici kimia cuma vuravurau 'apakʉnʉ takuisi mataa tupara 'uma.
'esi na tacʉvʉrʉ marʉkorapʉ. marivici kimia coma voravorao 'apakʉnʉ takoisi mataa topara 'oma.
S.TRANSL: 在牧場，叔叔帶我們餵羊和騎馬。
In the ranch, my uncle took us to feed the sheep and ride horses.

S.FORM: rovana, arakukunu kim mukusa tumʉra kumakʉnʉ.
rovana, arakokono kim mokosa tomʉra komakʉnʉ.
S.TRANSL: 晚上，我們一起去市區吃飯。
In the evening, we went to the city to have dinner together.

S.FORM: 'itumuru kuruma na tumʉra, imua tu'utupai kim mukusa 'inia.
'itomoro koroma na tomʉra, imoa to'otopai kim mokosa 'inia.
S.TRANSL: 市區車子很多，所以我們騎摩托車去那裡。
There are a lot of cars in the city, so we go there by motorcycle.

S.FORM: miaa tia cu muca, niko'ua 'utupai mia. 'inmamia cu tupasu aratʉkʉnʉ.
miaa tia co moca, niko'oa 'otopai mia. 'inmamia co topaso aratʉkʉnʉ.
S.TRANSL: 要離開的時候，發現摩托車被偷了。我們只好搭公車離開。
When we were about to leave, we found that the motorcycle had been stolen, so we had to leave by bus.

S.FORM: masini, pui'i cu kim na Taipe. nimʉtʉa cu kara cuma vuravurau tamna 'utupai?
masini, poi'i co kim na Taipe. nimʉtʉa co kara coma voravorao tamna 'otopai?
S.TRANSL: 現在我們回到台北了。不知道叔叔的摩托車找到了沒有？
Now that we are back in Taipei, I don't know if my uncle's motorcycle has been found.

S.FORM: miaa tati'ingi pa, 'esi kim na Namasia. marisinatʉ cu, aravari na Kaosiung. makasua monoon cu na tumʉra.
miaa tati'ingi pa, 'esi kim na Namasia. marisinatʉ co, aravari na Kaosiong. makasoa monoon co na tomʉra.
S.TRANSL: 小時候我們家住在那瑪夏，上學以後，就搬到了高雄，一直在都市裡生活。
When we were young, our family lived in Namasia. After I started school, we moved to Kaohsiung and have been living in the city ever since.

S.FORM: marisinatʉ na ta-sie. kiatuturu ku poisua Yencumin tamna mungka. takutavara'ʉ Taiwan Yencu mincu 'una macakuarʉ mungka.
marisinatʉ na ta-sie. kiatotoro ko poisoa Yencomin tamna mongka. takotavara'ʉ Taiwan Yenco minco 'ona macakoarʉ mongka.
S.TRANSL: 上了大學以後，我修了一堂關於原住民文化的課程，瞭解到臺灣原住民族有各式各樣豐富的文化。
After I went to college, I took a course on aboriginal culture and learned that the aboriginal people in Taiwan have various and rich cultures.

S.FORM: imua, cenana isi tarasangara kana'ʉcana. maracocua ku mataa kana'ua pui'i na tanasʉn kesoni mamarang. poisua takacicini cuku tamna mungka.
imoa, cenana isi tarasangara kana'ʉcana. maracocoa ko mataa kana'oa poi'i na tanasʉn kesoni mamarang. poisoa takacicini coko tamna mongka.
S.TRANSL: 因此，今年暑假時，我和哥哥回到部落訪問老人家，想要瞭解自己族群的文化。
So this summer, my brother and I went back to our tribe to visit the elderly, hoping to understand the culture of our own ethnic group.

S.FORM: maruun cu cenana mamarang, nakai makai pa kakana'ua nanmarua.
maroon co cenana mamarang, nakai makai pa kakana'oa nanmaroa.
S.TRANSL: 老人家已經八十歲了，但是看起來還像中年人。
The old man is already eighty years old, but he still looks like a middle-aged man.

S.FORM: kesoniʉn maku, neneni kari tavara'ʉa in? saihu nguain masiKanakanavu, tavara'ʉ pa masiSumukun, masiRipun.
kesoniʉn mako, neneni kari tavara'ʉa in? saiho ngoain masiKanakanavo, tavara'ʉ pa masiSomokon, masiRipon.
S.TRANSL: 我問他會哪些語言？他的卡那卡那富語說得很流利，也會說布農語和日本話。
I asked him which languages he knew, and he was fluent in Kanakanavu, as well as Bunun and Japanese.

S.FORM: kesoniʉn maku, imuava miaa tati'ingi pa. kiatuturu kari Ripun. 'ucangʉ in ia Bunun, imua 'itumuru tavara'ʉa in kari.
kesoniʉn mako, imoava miaa tati'ingi pa. kiatotoro kari Ripon. 'ocangʉ in ia Bonon, imoa 'itomoro tavara'ʉa in kari.
S.TRANSL: 我問他才知道，原來他小時候就學日本話，太太是布農族人，而他工作上認識許多客家人，所以他會說這麼多語言。
I asked him to find out that he learned Japanese when he was a child, his wife is an Bunun, and he knows many Hakkas at work, so he can speak so many languages.

S.FORM: tumatuturu kimia 'itumuru poisua aracakanʉ tamna macʉrang.
tomatotoro kimia 'itomoro poisoa aracakanʉ tamna macʉrang.
S.TRANSL: 我們訪談的時候，老人家談論了許多關於狩獵的傳統知識。
During our interview, the old man talked about a lot of traditional knowledge about hunting.

S.FORM: 'apaco'e ka'anʉ kim akanangʉn kavangvang, nakai 'urupacʉʉn mia ramucu tangsua mapusikarʉ 'aningu, tavara'ʉn pa maka'ʉna tumatimana.
'apaco'e ka'anʉ kim akanangʉn kavangvang, nakai 'oropacʉʉn mia ramoco tangsoa maposikarʉ 'aningo, tavara'ʉn pa maka'ʉna tomatimana.
S.TRANSL: 雖然我們沒有辦法完全聽懂，但是我們有用手機錄影，可以再仔細聆聽。
Although we could’t fully understand it, we could record it on our cell phones and listen to it more.

S.FORM: miaa tati'ingi, ka'anʉ tavara'ʉ takacicini tamna mungka. maraini tumatuturu sua iku ia Cau Vuvurung.
miaa tati'ingi, ka'anʉ tavara'ʉ takacicini tamna mongka. maraini tomatotoro soa iko ia Cao Vovorong.
S.TRANSL: 小時候我不瞭解自己族群的文化，對於自己是原住民有點不好意思。
When I was young, I didn’t understand the culture of my ethnic group, and I was a little embarrassed that I was an aborigine.

S.FORM: 'itumru cu tavara'ʉa. cucuruava tukupecu sua Kanakanavu, purangrang cʉpʉngʉ.
'itomro co tavara'ʉa. cocoroava tokopeco soa Kanakanavo, porangrang cʉpʉngʉ.
S.TRANSL: 瞭解愈多以後，愈覺得自己身為卡那卡那富人，是很獨特的，也很值得驕傲。
The more I know, the more I feel that being a Kanakanavu is unique and something to be proud of.

S.FORM: rovana soni, tia cu pui'i kanarua sarunai.
rovana soni, tia co poi'i kanaroa saronai.
S.TRANSL: 今天傍晚，弟弟就要回家了。
My younger brother is going home this evening.

S.FORM: maracocua ku mataa tamu mukusa tamia'aa pu'a tarukuka, rovana tia kim mati'arangʉ sa'o'o kʉnʉa 'apakʉnʉ kanarua.
maracocoa ko mataa tamo mokosa tamia'aa po'a tarokoka, rovana tia kim mati'arangʉ sa'o'o kʉnʉa 'apakʉnʉ kanaroa.
S.TRANSL: 我和奶奶去市場買雞，準備煮好吃的晚餐給弟弟。
My grandma and I went to the market to buy chickens and prepared a delicious dinner for my younger brother.

S.FORM: maica kim na tamia'aa, 'itumuru mata'ʉ natʉngʉ.
maica kim na tamia'aa, 'itomoro mata'ʉ natʉngʉ.
S.TRANSL: 我們經過了菜攤，菜攤有好多新鮮的青菜。
We passed the vegetable stand, which had a lot of fresh green vegetables.

S.FORM: nipu'a kim tarako natʉngʉ, vakure mataa cepo.
nipo'a kim tarako natʉngʉ, vakore mataa cepo.
S.TRANSL: 我們買了空心菜、山藥和胡蘿蔔。
We bought water spinach, yams and carrots.

S.FORM: ciciri 'inia rau-pan makasi, "matavi'isi pangtan mataa mamiki maku, tanamaan pu'a ti'ingi."
ciciri 'inia rao-pan makasi, "matavi'isi pangtan mataa mamiki mako, tanamaan po'a ti'ingi."
S.TRANSL: 旁邊水果攤的老闆說:「我的鳳梨和桃子很甜。買一些吧!」
The owner of the nearby fruit stand said: “My pineapples and peaches are very sweet. Buy some!”

S.FORM: nipa'a kim pangtan mataa mamiki.
nipa'a kim pangtan mataa mamiki.
S.TRANSL: 我們買了鳳梨和桃子。
We bought pineapples and peaches.

S.FORM: maica kim na tamia'aa 'aramʉ. makasi rau-pan, "neni tia pu'aa musu? tarukuka soni, tatia, ma'angirisi. ucani turu mʉna."
maica kim na tamia'aa 'aramʉ. makasi rao-pan, "neni tia po'aa moso? tarokoka soni, tatia, ma'angirisi. ocani toro mʉna."
S.TRANSL: 我們經過了肉攤，老闆說:「你要買什麼?今天的雞又大又肥，一隻300元。」
We passed the meat stall, and the boss said, “What do you want to buy? Today’s chickens are big and fat, and one is 300 NTD.”

S.FORM: rangrang misee tamu. kesoni na rau-pan, tʉni kara yasui ti'ingi?
rangrang misee tamo. kesoni na rao-pan, tʉni kara yasoi ti'ingi?
S.TRANSL: 奶奶覺得太貴了，問老闆可不可以便宜一點。
Grandma thought it was too expensive and asked the boss if it could be cheaper.

S.FORM: nakai makasi rau-pan, yasui cu misee, ka'anʉ cu tʉni mana'ʉ.
nakai makasi rao-pan, yasoi co misee, ka'anʉ co tʉni mana'ʉ.
S.TRANSL: 但老闆說已經很便宜，不能再減了。
But the boss said that it is already very cheap and cannot be reduced any further.

S.FORM: akini 'inia rau-pan makasi, ivataa pu'a vutukuru maku. vutukuru maku tatia mataa yasui misee.
akini 'inia rao-pan makasi, ivataa po'a votokoro mako. votokoro mako tatia mataa yasoi misee.
S.TRANSL: 隔壁的老闆說，來買我的魚，我的魚又大又便宜。
The boss next door said, come and buy my fish, my fish is big and cheap.

S.FORM: marivivini, nipu'a kim tarukuka mataa vutukuru, pui'i tanasa po'ucipi kim cani pangka camai.
marivivini, nipo'a kim tarokoka mataa votokoro, poi'i tanasa po'ocipi kim cani pangka camai.
S.TRANSL: 最後我們買了雞也買了魚，回家煮了一桌子的菜。
In the end we bought chicken and fish, and went home to cook a table of food.

S.FORM: miaranau maritarʉ. mapitʉ'ʉ cu kakangca.
miaranao maritarʉ. mapitʉ'ʉ co kakangca.
S.TRANSL: 等了好久，天已經黑了。
After waiting for a long time, it was already dark.

S.FORM: paritangsua kanarua sarunai makasi, surumu hetai ka'anʉ tarasangai. tia kani maka'ʉna tarasangara pui'i misee.
paritangsoa kanaroa saronai makasi, soromo hetai ka'anʉ tarasangai. tia kani maka'ʉna tarasangara poi'i misee.
S.TRANSL: 弟弟打電話回來說，軍隊突然不能放假了，要下一個禮拜日才回來。
The younger brother called back and said that the army suddenly couldn’t take a vacation and would not be back until the next Sunday.

S.FORM: makasi tamu, macakuarʉ cu nipo'ucipia. pukario kavangvang 'apivatu kumʉkʉnʉ!
makasi tamo, macakoarʉ co nipo'ocipia. pokario kavangvang 'apivato komʉkʉnʉ!
S.TRANSL: 奶奶說已經煮了這麼多，叫大家一起來吃吧!
Grandma said that she has cooked so much, so let’s eat together!

S.FORM: pokariʉn mia kacaua kincaua, kunganganʉ macakuarʉ rovana.
pokariʉn mia kacaoa kincaoa, konganganʉ macakoarʉ rovana.
S.TRANSL: 我們邀請了親朋好友，一起來享用豐盛的晚餐。
We invited friends and family to have a great dinner together.

S.FORM: 'una ku tacini kʉkʉnang marisinatʉ Pa'ʉ kisʉʉn, paira nguain roimi marivici nonoman.
'ona ko tacini kʉkʉnang marisinatʉ Pa'ʉ kisʉʉn, paira ngoain roimi marivici nonoman.
S.TRANSL: 我有一個同學叫Pa’ʉ，他常常忘記帶東西。
I have a classmate named Pa’ʉ, he often forgets to bring things.

S.FORM: noo tia cu marisinatʉ, sumasuruvai na cucumeni siarisinatʉ, sia'ucu'ucu nukai tapasinatʉ.
noo tia co marisinatʉ, somasorovai na cocomeni siarisinatʉ, sia'oco'oco nokai tapasinatʉ.
S.TRANSL: 上課的時候，他跟同學借鉛筆、橡皮擦或是筆記本。
During class, he borrowed pencils, erasers or notebooks from his classmates.

S.FORM: makaan, makacusa, makaturu, 'apasuruvaiʉn cau.
makaan, makacosa, makatoro, 'apasorovaiʉn cao.
S.TRANSL: 一次、兩次、三次，大家會借東西給他。
Once, twice, three times, everyone would lend him something.

S.FORM: nakai, 'una nguain aka niurina. paira sumasuruvai ka'anʉ mai'i.
nakai, 'ona ngoain aka niorina. paira somasorovai ka'anʉ mai'i.
S.TRANSL: 但是他有個壞習慣，經常借了東西卻不還。
But he has a bad habit of often borrowing things but not returning them.

S.FORM: marivivini, ka'anʉ cu cau 'apasuruvai 'inia nonoman.
marivivini, ka'anʉ co cao 'apasorovai 'inia nonoman.
S.TRANSL: 最後大家都不想借他東西了。
In the end, no one wanted to borrow anything from him.

S.FORM: 'una cani taniara. arakukunu kim mutaira sumasima'ʉ.
'ona cani taniara. arakokono kim motaira somasima'ʉ.
S.TRANSL: 有一天，我們大家一起去郊遊。
One day, we all went on an outing together.

S.FORM: na cacanʉ, tia muta'i sua Pa'ʉ. nakai niroimi nguain marivici cirikami.
na cacanʉ, tia mota'i soa Pa'ʉ. nakai niroimi ngoain marivici cirikami.
S.TRANSL: 路途中，Pa’ʉ想上廁所，但他忘記帶衛生紙。
On the way, Pa’ʉ wanted to go to the bathroom, but he forgot to bring toilet paper.

S.FORM: sumasuruvai nguain na kʉkʉnang, nakai arivariʉn kavangvang makasi, koo ku kangvang marivici cirikami.
somasorovai ngoain na kʉkʉnang, nakai arivariʉn kavangvang makasi, koo ko kangvang marivici cirikami.
S.TRANSL: 他跟同學借衛生紙，可是大家都回他說，我也沒有帶耶。
He borrowed toilet paper from his classmates, but everyone told him that I didn’t bring them either.

S.FORM: mamumʉkʉ cu Pa'ʉ. arakuracʉ makasi, miseni kamu ka'anʉ 'apasuruvai 'ikua cirikami?
mamomʉkʉ co Pa'ʉ. arakoracʉ makasi, miseni kamo ka'anʉ 'apasorovai 'ikoa cirikami?
S.TRANSL: Pa’ʉ急的哭了出來。他生氣的說，為什麼大家都不借我衛生紙？
Pa’ʉ burst into tears. He said angrily, why don’t everyone lend me toilet paper!

S.FORM: tuturuʉn kʉkʉnang, vanai sii ka'anʉ kasu takacicini marivici. mataa sumasuruvai kasu nonoman, ka'anʉ mai'i.
totoroʉn kʉkʉnang, vanai sii ka'anʉ kaso takacicini marivici. mataa somasorovai kaso nonoman, ka'anʉ mai'i.
S.TRANSL: 同學告訴他，因為你都不自己帶，而且借給你的東西，你都不會還!
The classmate told him, because you didn’t bring it yourself, and you wouldn’t return the things lent to you!

S.FORM: akini taniara. mucʉmcʉm Pa'ʉ mukusa tarisinata. siniruvai nonoman ai'iʉn kee na kʉkʉnang.
akini taniara. mocʉmcʉm Pa'ʉ mokosa tarisinata. sinirovai nonoman ai'iʉn kee na kʉkʉnang.
S.TRANSL: 隔天上學，Pa’ʉ很早就到學校了，Pa’ʉ把跟同學借的東西都還給同學們。
The next day at school, Pa’ʉ arrived at school early and returned everything he had borrowed from his classmates.

S.FORM: musu'ʉvʉ Pa'ʉ na kʉkʉnang. makasi, no'unaan tia kani takacicini marivici nonoman. sosomanpe misee na kʉkʉnang, me'inaan nipasuruvai 'inia nonoman.
moso'ʉvʉ Pa'ʉ na kʉkʉnang. makasi, no'onaan tia kani takacicini marivici nonoman. sosomanpe misee na kʉkʉnang, me'inaan nipasorovai 'inia nonoman.
S.TRANSL: Pa’ʉ向同學們道歉，並說他以後一定會自己帶東西，也謝謝同學們之前願意借他東西。
Pa’ʉ apologized to the students and said that he would definitely bring his own things in the future, and thanked the classmates for their willingness to lend him things before.

S.FORM: sua cuma maku ia cau aracakanʉ.
soa coma mako ia cao aracakanʉ.
S.TRANSL: 我的爸爸是部落的獵人。
My dad is a hunter of the tribe.

S.FORM: miaa tati'ingi pa ku. cuma mataa cuma vuravurau arapipiningi noo rovana. sikinumanʉ marivici nantu.
miaa tati'ingi pa ko. coma mataa coma voravorao arapipiningi noo rovana. sikinomanʉ marivici nanto.
S.TRANSL: 我小的時候，爸爸和叔叔會在晚上出門，帶著獵刀和獵槍。
When I was little, my dad and uncle would go out at night with hunting knives and guns.

S.FORM: araciasʉ, marivici cu nguani niaracakana pui'i.
araciasʉ, marivici co ngoani niaracakana poi'i.
S.TRANSL: 天亮時，他們就會帶著獵到的獵物回來。
At daybreak, they returned with their prey.

S.FORM: 'apanapa vavuru, rarʉ, 'apanapa 'una tivukarʉ.
'apanapa vavoro, rarʉ, 'apanapa 'ona tivokarʉ.
S.TRANSL: 有時候是山豬、有時候是飛鼠，偶爾也會有雉雞。
Sometimes it was a boar, sometimes a flying squirrel, and occasionally a pheasant.

S.FORM: 'esi na taira, sovunguʉn cu nguani 'aramʉ.
'esi na taira, sovongoʉn co ngoani 'aramʉ.
S.TRANSL: 他們會在村口將獵物分好，分享給族人。
They would divide the prey at the entrance of the village and share it with the tribe.

S.FORM: paira ku makari cuma, tia kipapa 'inia aracakanʉ.
paira ko makari coma, tia kipapa 'inia aracakanʉ.
S.TRANSL: 我每次都會吵著爸爸，要跟著爸爸去打獵。
Every time I quarreled with my father, I wanted to go hunting with my father.

S.FORM: makasi cuma, noo aratatia cu ku, tia kani marivici 'ikua.
makasi coma, noo aratatia co ko, tia kani marivici 'ikoa.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸說等我長大了他再帶我一起去。
Dad said that he would take me with me when I grew up.

S.FORM: tanasʉn sasarunai, rumaringai nukai kamanʉngʉ tarʉnʉ matisa'ʉ marʉkurapʉ.
tanasʉn sasaronai, romaringai nokai kamanʉngʉ tarʉnʉ matisa'ʉ marʉkorapʉ.
S.TRANSL: 部落的男人也會用陷阱抓獵物，他們會製作套索陷阱和石壓式陷阱。
The men of the tribe also trap their prey, making lasso traps and rock traps.

S.FORM: saihu cuma maku cumacipi. makasi, sua isi ia siaripaca matisa'ʉ tivukarʉ. tia cumacʉ'ʉra 'anuka nipaicaa. musʉ'ʉ 'inia sua cipi.
saiho coma mako comacipi. makasi, soa isi ia siaripaca matisa'ʉ tivokarʉ. tia comacʉ'ʉra 'anoka nipaicaa. mosʉ'ʉ 'inia soa cipi.
S.TRANSL: 我的爸爸很會製作套索陷阱，爸爸說，這是用來捕抓雉雞的，我們要仔細觀察獵物的腳印，陷阱要放在獵物走的路上。

My dad is very good at making lasso traps. Dad said that this is used to catch pheasants. We have to carefully observe the footprints of the prey, and the traps should be placed on the path of the prey.

S.FORM: vanai tia kipapa kakana'ua aracakanʉ. tantaniara ku rinsiu kamanʉngʉ ringai. makacang, tʉni cu ringai maku matisa'ʉ marʉkurapʉ.
vanai tia kipapa kakana'oa aracakanʉ. tantaniara ko rinsio kamanʉngʉ ringai. makacang, tʉni co ringai mako matisa'ʉ marʉkorapʉ.
S.TRANSL: 為了可以趕快和大人一起去打獵，我每天練習製作陷阱，很快地我的陷阱就真的可以抓到獵物了。
In order to go hunting with adults as soon as possible, I practiced making traps every day, and soon my traps can really catch prey.

S.FORM: cumacʉ'ʉra cuma maku makasi, nuari tia mintasʉ kasu aracakanʉ.
comacʉ'ʉra coma mako makasi, noari tia mintasʉ kaso aracakanʉ.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸看到後對我說我以後一定會是很厲害的獵人。
Dad saw it and told me that I will be a very good hunter in the future.

S.FORM: masini tatia cu ku. ariviciʉ maku rupacʉ, vuru. kipapa cuma aracakanʉ.
masini tatia co ko. ariviciʉ mako ropacʉ, voro. kipapa coma aracakanʉ.
S.TRANSL: 現在我長大了，我背起我的弓和箭矢，跟著爸爸一起去打獵。
Now that I have grown up, I carry my bow and arrows and go hunting with my father.

S.FORM: pui'i tanasʉn sovunguʉn niaracakana movua kincaucaua.
poi'i tanasʉn sovongoʉn niaracakana movoa kincaocaoa.
S.TRANSL: 回村時將獵到的獵物和族人們分享。
When returning to the village, share the hunted prey with the tribe.

S.FORM: makasi cuma, tia kita musu'ʉvʉ tamutamua, movua tikata macakuarʉ marʉkurapʉ.
makasi coma, tia kita moso'ʉvʉ tamotamoa, movoa tikata macakoarʉ marʉkorapʉ.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸說，我們要感謝祖靈賜福，讓我們有很多獵物收穫。
Dad said, we want to thank the ancestors for their blessings, so that we have a lot of prey to harvest.

S.FORM: 'apaca'ivi takananga ku totasiarʉ.
'apaca'ivi takananga ko totasiarʉ.
S.TRANSL: 我早上上學遲到了。
I was late for school this morning.

S.FORM: miaa mukusa tarisinata, niroimi ku marivici kapaang.
miaa mokosa tarisinata, niroimi ko marivici kapaang.
S.TRANSL: 去學校的時候，我忘了帶書包。
When I was going to school, I forgot to bring my backpack.

S.FORM: koo ku marivici avara'e nonoman.
koo ko marivici avara'e nonoman.
S.TRANSL: 我什麼東西都沒有帶。
I didn’t bring anything with me.

S.FORM: miaa kiatuturu, arakukunu ku kʉkʉnang cumacʉ'ʉra sinatʉ.
miaa kiatotoro, arakokono ko kʉkʉnang comacʉ'ʉra sinatʉ.
S.TRANSL: 上課的時候，我和同學一起看課本。
During class, I and my classmates read the textbook together.

S.FORM: miaa sikingi, 'apasuruvai 'ikua kʉkʉnang siarisinatʉ mataa sia'ucu'ucu.
miaa sikingi, 'apasorovai 'ikoa kʉkʉnang siarisinatʉ mataa sia'oco'oco.
S.TRANSL: 考試的時候，同學借我筆和橡皮擦。
During the exam, a classmate lent me a pen and an eraser.

S.FORM: makasi 'ikua takituturua, "no'unaan mucʉmcʉmʉa aramia'ʉ, 'akuni cu 'apaca'ivi takananga!"
makasi 'ikoa takitotoroa, "no'onaan mocʉmcʉmʉa aramia'ʉ, 'akoni co 'apaca'ivi takananga!"
S.TRANSL: 老師跟我說：「下次早點起床，不要再遲到了!」
The teacher told me, “Wake up earlier next time and don’t be late again!”

S.FORM: sua tangria maku Pani, Kanakanavu tamna manu kangvang sua nguain.
soa tangria mako Pani, Kanakanavo tamna mano kangvang soa ngoain.
S.TRANSL: 我的好朋友叫Pani，他也是卡那卡那富族的小孩。
My good friend’s name is Pani, and he is also an Kanakanavu child.

S.FORM: arakukunu kim na Namasia marisinatʉ.
arakokono kim na Namasia marisinatʉ.
S.TRANSL: 我們一起在那瑪夏部落讀書。
We study together in the Namasia tribe.

S.FORM: paira kim arakukunu tumatimana mamarang po'ʉ'ʉna.
paira kim arakokono tomatimana mamarang po'ʉ'ʉna.
S.TRANSL: 我們常常一起聽耆老說故事，我們都很會說卡那卡那富語。
We often listen to the elders telling stories together, and we both can speak the Kanakanavu proficiently.

S.FORM: marʉngʉcai ku mataa ciuman kangvang. manʉkʉpai mataa ta'uici sua Pani.
marʉngʉcai ko mataa cioman kangvang. manʉkʉpai mataa ta'oici soa Pani.
S.TRANSL: 我很高也很胖，Pani很矮也很瘦。
I am tall and overweight, while Pani is short and thin.

S.FORM: ma'intasʉ sua Pani, manmaan kavangvnag cau na 'inia.
ma'intasʉ soa Pani, manmaan kavangvnag cao na 'inia.
S.TRANSL: Pani很有活力，大家都很喜歡他。
Pani is very energetic, and everyone likes him a lot.

S.FORM: soni ia tarisinata tamna 'untukai. 'itumuru tia arumuana.
soni ia tarisinata tamna 'ontokai. 'itomoro tia aromoana.
S.TRANSL: 今天是學校的運動會，學校舉辦了許多競賽。
Today was the school's sports day, and the school organized many competitions.

S.FORM: 'una marisʉ'ʉsʉ'ʉrʉ, putaitairi, arapana'ʉ, musutatunu mataa purasini.
'ona marisʉ'ʉsʉ'ʉrʉ, potaitairi, arapana'ʉ, mosotatono mataa porasini.
S.TRANSL: 有拔河、足球、跑步、跳舞和射箭。
There were tug of war, soccer, running, dancing, and archery.

S.FORM: matipa ku arapana'ʉ.
matipa ko arapana'ʉ.
S.TRANSL: 我比賽跑步。
I participated in the running competition.

S.FORM: miaa arapana'ʉ ku, sutupuku! musucara'ʉ 'ʉvʉ maku.
miaa arapana'ʉ ko, sotopoko! mosocara'ʉ 'ʉvʉ mako.
S.TRANSL: 當我跑步的時候，我跌倒了，膝蓋流了很多血。
When I was running, I fell down, and my knees were bleeding.

S.FORM: nakai aratakarʉ ku, macuvungu arapana'ʉ!
nakai aratakarʉ ko, macovongo arapana'ʉ!
S.TRANSL: 但我站起來，繼續向前跑。
But I stood up and continued running forward.

S.FORM: miaa makacʉkʉna ku, macangcangarʉ kavangvang cau!
miaa makacʉkʉna ko, macangcangarʉ kavangvang cao!
S.TRANSL: 我到終點時所有人都很開心。
Everyone was happy when I reached the finish line.

S.FORM: 'apaco'e koo mara ta'uru-1, nakai macangcangarʉ ku. sii turupang ku arumuanʉ.
'apaco'e koo mara ta'oro-1, nakai macangcangarʉ ko. sii toropang ko aromoanʉ.
S.TRANSL: 雖然沒有獲得第一名，但我很高興，因為我完成了比賽。
Although I didn't get first place, I'm glad because I completed the race.

S.FORM: miʉra iku mataa cuma, rovʉvʉ na cuma vuravurau maku.
miʉra iko mataa coma, rovʉvʉ na coma voravorao mako.
S.TRANSL: 昨天我和爸爸去拜訪我的叔叔。
Yesterday, my father and I visited my uncle.

S.FORM: musuvakʉrʉ 'acipi cuma vuravurau.
mosovakʉrʉ 'acipi coma voravorao.
S.TRANSL: 叔叔的腳受傷了。
My uncle injured his foot.

S.FORM: makasi kimia, ravi'a ucani tarako sua 'aruvu.
makasi kimia, ravi'a ocani tarako soa 'arovo.
S.TRANSL: 他告訴我們，房子的屋頂破了一個洞。
He told us that there was a hole in the roof of his house.

S.FORM: miaa mati'ʉnʉ'ʉna 'aruvu ia, aranai 'aruvu musurai.
miaa mati'ʉnʉ'ʉna 'arovo ia, aranai 'arovo mosorai.
S.TRANSL: 他在修理屋頂時，從屋頂摔下來了。
He fell off the roof while repairing it.

S.FORM: niarivici cuma 'aramʉ karavung mataa 'aviki movua cuma vuravurau.
niarivici coma 'aramʉ karavong mataa 'aviki movoa coma voravorao.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸帶了牛肉和檳榔給叔叔。
My father brought beef and betel nuts for my uncle.

S.FORM: parʉ'ʉna ku mataa cuma vuravurau, pasovungu nguain 'itumuru 'ʉna.
parʉ'ʉna ko mataa coma voravorao, pasovongo ngoain 'itomoro 'ʉna.
S.TRANSL: 我和叔叔在房間裡聊天，他分享了很多故事。
My uncle and I chatted in the room, and he shared many stories.

S.FORM: miaa tia cu aratʉkʉnʉ, makasi cuma vuravurau, marʉngʉcai cu ku, marumanʉngʉ misee.
miaa tia co aratʉkʉnʉ, makasi coma voravorao, marʉngʉcai co ko, maromanʉngʉ misee.
S.TRANSL: 我要離開前，叔叔誇我長高了，也變得更帥氣了。
Before I left, my uncle praised me for growing taller and becoming more handsome.

S.FORM: makasi ku, "noo manʉng cu 'acipi, ivataa kangvang na tanasa mia."
makasi ko, "noo manʉng co 'acipi, ivataa kangvang na tanasa mia."
S.TRANSL: 我說：「等叔叔腳好了，下次也來我們家玩。」
I said, “When your foot gets better, come to our house next time and visit us.”

S.FORM: 2022 cenana, makarikari sehu Yencumin tamna nipinsiu tʉni arisinatʉn Cau Vuvurung tamna nganai.
2022 cenana, makarikari seho Yencomin tamna nipinsio tʉni arisinatʉn Cao Vovorong tamna nganai.
S.TRANSL: 在2022年，政府召開了原住民身分證可單列族名的會議。
In 2022, the government announced that indigenous identification cards can include tribal names separately.

S.FORM: kesoniʉn maku miaranau cu makinee na sehu, nipinsiu tia marisinatʉ "caukia nganai" sua nanmarua puraku Pa'ʉ.
kesoniʉn mako miaranao co makinee na seho, nipinsio tia marisinatʉ "caokia nganai" soa nanmaroa porako Pa'ʉ.
S.TRANSL: 我訪問了長期向政府爭取身分證「單列族名」的部落青年Pa’ʉ。
I interviewed Pa’ʉ, a young tribal member who has long been advocating for the inclusion of tribal names on identification cards.

S.FORM: 'arupatuturu kim na tarasangara isi, tia mukusa tanasa in kesoni 'inia.
'aropatotoro kim na tarasangara isi, tia mokosa tanasa in kesoni 'inia.
S.TRANSL: 我和他約定好這個假日到他家訪問他。
We had arranged to visit his home this holiday for the interview.

S.FORM: miaa kesoni 'inia, siukai nguain niaranai nanu sua nganai in. marivici pa 'ikua tarakanangʉ cau tanasa in, mataa nguain tamna puraku.
miaa kesoni 'inia, siokai ngoain niaranai nano soa nganai in. marivici pa 'ikoa tarakanangʉ cao tanasa in, mataa ngoain tamna porako.
S.TRANSL: 在訪問的過程中，他向我介紹了他的名字的由來，也帶我認識了他的家人、他的部落。
During the interview, he introduced to me the origin of his name and also introduced me to his family and tribe.

S.FORM: kesoniʉn maku, miseni manatʉrʉ cʉpʉngʉ tia mati'ʉnʉ'ʉna nganai, cʉngnan niarisinatʉa 'esi nanu aka?
kesoniʉn mako, miseni manatʉrʉ cʉpʉngʉ tia mati'ʉnʉ'ʉna nganai, cʉngnan niarisinatʉa 'esi nano aka?
S.TRANSL: 我問他為什麼堅持要改名，舊的登記方式不好嗎?
I asked him why he insisted on changing his name. Wasn’t the old registration method sufficient?

S.FORM: makasi 'ikua, 'urupaca Nakasayana ka'anʉ tʉni munasʉ sumasʉpʉrʉ nganai in. 'una pa cau marisusuna 'inia "巴先生" misee. 'itumuru makasua pacacaʉn.
makasi 'ikoa, 'oropaca Nakasayana ka'anʉ tʉni monasʉ somasʉpʉrʉ nganai in. 'ona pa cao marisosona 'inia "巴先生" misee. 'itomoro makasoa pacacaʉn.
S.TRANSL: \" which resulted in many jokes being made."
He told me that using Chinese characters could not accurately convey his name, and others would still call him \Ba Xian Sheng

S.FORM: makasi Pa'ʉ: "'urupaca Yencumin kari nganai ia, cucuru nganai mita. nganai maku 'esi 'inia cuku mita, cʉpʉngana mita, tina'an nganara mita, kamʉcʉ arakacaua cuakia tʉni mʉtʉa takacicini tamna nganai."

makasi Pa'ʉ: "'oropaca Yencomin kari nganai ia, cocoro nganai mita. nganai mako 'esi 'inia coko mita, cʉpʉngana mita, tina'an nganara mita, kamʉcʉ arakacaoa coakia tʉni mʉtʉa takacicini tamna nganai."
S.TRANSL: Pa’ʉ說：「原住民語書寫的名字才是我們真正的名字。我的名字代表了我們的族群、我們的家族、我們的身分，希望能有更多族人找回自己的名字。」

Noami Kulas said, “The names written in indigenous languages are our true names. My name represents our ethnic group, our family, our identity. I hope more fellow tribespeople can reclaim their own names.”

S.FORM: miʉra kipapa ku tamu nanakʉ mukusa tamia'aa mapupu'a. niarivici tamu 'itumuru tinakacicini mumʉkʉ natʉngʉ. kamanʉngʉ pa Cau Vuvurung tamna sa'o'o kʉkʉnʉa.
miʉra kipapa ko tamo nanakʉ mokosa tamia'aa mapopo'a. niarivici tamo 'itomoro tinakacicini momʉkʉ natʉngʉ. kamanʉngʉ pa Cao Vovorong tamna sa'o'o kʉkʉnʉa.
S.TRANSL: 昨天我跟奶奶去市集擺攤，奶奶帶了許多自己種的蔬菜去，也製作了原住民美食給大家。
Yesterday, I went to the market with my grandmother to set up a stall. My grandmother brought a lot of vegetables that she grew herself and also prepared indigenous cuisine for everyone.

S.FORM: ka'anmanʉn cau tamu tamna tamia'aa. manman mataa 'arikuriki kacaua cau pu'a. kacaua kangvang cau kutanamʉ nipo'ucipia kee kʉkʉnʉa.
ka'anmanʉn cao tamo tamna tamia'aa. manman mataa 'arikoriki kacaoa cao po'a. kacaoa kangvang cao kotanamʉ nipo'ocipia kee kʉkʉnʉa.
S.TRANSL: 大家很喜歡奶奶的攤位，辣椒和車輪茄很多人買，許多人來品嘗她煮的菜餚。
Everyone loved my grandmother’s stall. Many people bought the chilis and African eggplants, and many people came to taste the dishes she cooked.

S.FORM: nipo'ucipia kee tariri mataa tipi cucuru sa'o'o, cinapa kee 'aramʉ vavuru, maricucu kacaua 'okiaku. matavʉnʉrʉ na ikim tamna tamia'aa.
nipo'ocipia kee tariri mataa tipi cocoro sa'o'o, cinapa kee 'aramʉ vavoro, maricoco kacaoa 'okiako. matavʉnʉrʉ na ikim tamna tamia'aa.
S.TRANSL: 她煮的蕨菜和糯米飯非常好吃，還有烤山豬肉煮，味道吸引了很多客人，大家都來我們攤位排隊。
The ferns and sticky rice she cooked were delicious, as well as the braised pork with maqaw pepper and wild boar meat. The flavors attracted many customers, and everyone lined up at our stall.

S.FORM: 'esiin po'icipi tamu, 'esi ku ciciri mariapa 'okiaku. marisusuna ku, "tinakacicini mumʉkʉ natʉngʉ, koo pucanumuʉn savuana, ivataa pu'a!"
'esiin po'icipi tamo, 'esi ko ciciri mariapa 'okiako. marisosona ko, "tinakacicini momʉkʉ natʉngʉ, koo pocanomoʉn savoana, ivataa po'a!"
S.TRANSL: all-natural and organic! Come and buy now!\""
While my grandmother was cooking, I was on the side attracting customers. I shouted, \The vegetables are self-grown

S.FORM: nonoman mia makacang vangvangʉʉn cu mapu'a. makasi tamu, "vanai sii 'una kasu muranʉ."
nonoman mia makacang vangvangʉʉn co mapo'a. makasi tamo, "vanai sii 'ona kaso moranʉ."
S.TRANSL: 我們的東西很快就賣完了，奶奶說：「都是因為有你的幫忙。」
Our goods sold out quickly, and my grandmother said, \It’s all thanks to your help.\""

S.FORM: matacuvungu isi, takutavarʉ'ʉ ku poisua karukarua mataa kʉkʉnʉa macʉrʉng, takutavarʉ'ʉ pa cucuru mupacai sua mapu'a kasiupai.
matacovongo isi, takotavarʉ'ʉ ko poisoa karokaroa mataa kʉkʉnʉa macʉrʉng, takotavarʉ'ʉ pa cocoro mopacai soa mapo'a kasiopai.
S.TRANSL: 這個活動，我學到了有關原住民植物和食品的知識，並且體驗到了擺攤的辛苦。
Through this event, I learned about indigenous plants and food and experienced the hard work of running a stall.

S.FORM: cumacʉ'ʉra tamu masakʉn niurina kʉkʉnʉa, cucuru ku purangatʉ mataa ma'incu.
comacʉ'ʉra tamo masakʉn niorina kʉkʉnʉa, cocoro ko porangatʉ mataa ma'inco.
S.TRANSL: 看到了奶奶對傳統食物的熱愛，我感到非常驕傲和榮幸。
Seeing my grandmother’s passion for traditional food, I feel very proud and honored.
